Class TileSet

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
java.util.AbstractList<E>
java.util.ArrayList<Tile>
TileSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Tile>, Collection<Tile>, List<Tile>, RandomAccess
public class TileSet extends ArrayList<Tile>
An array list consist of all the tiles that will be displayed on the board.

      public boolean nothingInCheckFor(Tile target, boolean isBlack)
      Check if any chess piece can take it if a chess piece is on the tile.
      Parameters:
      target - : the tile to check.
      isBlack - : the color of the chess piece.
      Returns:
      whether any chess piece can take it if a chess piece is on the tile.

    • noAvailableMove

      public boolean noAvailableMove()
      See if there is any movable tile in the set. (use after set suggest move of a chess piece) (mainly checking for checkmate).
      Returns:
      whether there is any movable tile in the set.

    • getKing

      Find the tile of the king (black or white) is on and return it.
      Parameters:
      isBlack - : color of the king to find.
      Returns:
      the tile of the king (black or white) is on.
